Title: Elections and Electoral Roll Management Software
Description:
The requirement is for an Electoral Registration System that maintains details of those eligible to be included on the electoral register. The register currently comprises of around 180,000 electors and produces monthly electoral registers for use by the Electoral Registration Officer's team, Political Parties and other organisations.

The system should be able to operate in line with changing guidance on Individual Electoral Registration (IER) which was first implemented in June 2014. We would like the system to link with Open Text (the Councils Document Management System) so that forms can be scanned to the Electoral system at point of receipt into the building. We also need the facility to bulk email / text electors where required to save paper forms going to households. The new system needs to have the flexibility to manage more efficiently the process of notifying electors of changes or the requirement to take action to register through electronic channels such as online sources, email and text messaging.

The system should also be capable of managing an election through Candidates and Agents details, nominations, staffing, production of poll cards, ballot papers and the management of the postal voting system. The system needs to link through Government Connect to external sites such as DWP, electoral roll and print service suppliers. Ideally the system should be capable of running / hosting a results service and publishing data relating to this via the Council's website.

Please note, suppliers wishing to express interest and obtain the documentation, must do so by 14:00 on 03/11/2016. It is recommended that you express interest and obtain the documentation well before this time to allow sufficient time to prepare and submit a comprehensive response. The deadline for returns is 14:00 on 04/11/2016. You must visit https://www.eastmidstenders.org to express interest and obtain the documents. Please note we will only accept expressions of interest through the e-tendering system.
Additional Text: Contract end date is 31/03/2020 with two annual options to extend until 31/03/2022.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Xpress Software Solutions Ltd|33 Clarendon Road, London, N8 0NW|||No|No]

Title: DBC (AL) Election Management System - AWARD
Description:
Dacorum Borough Council (The Council) have been utilising an Electoral Registration and Elections Management System since 2009 which enables The Council to co-ordinate and conduct elections and referenda on behalf of The Council's Returning Officer.  
       
      The current system has served The Council well however, rather than invest significant funds on an upgrade The Council are keen to review the market to see which solution would serve us best over the next 5 years.  
       
      The new system must support a customer focused service that meets the needs of The Council's clients, maximising participation in the electoral process and fulfilling The Council's responsibilities in relation to elections and the register of electors. 
       
      In purchasing a new system, the Council hopes to achieve the following:
      - Assist the continuous improvement of the Electoral Services department  
      - Facilitate the successful delivery of elections and referenda  
      - Provide statistics and reports as required to conform to statutory requirements  
      - Develop the foundation on which to accurately compile and maintain the register of electors  
      - Provide a high quality and effective Electoral Services to our customers and stakeholders  
      - Comply with data standards and ensure a link to LLPG (BS7666) 
      - Ability to undertake signature, barcode and numerical recognition for Absent voting, ITR Forms and HEFs.  
      - Ability to interface with telephone, internet and SMS registration services.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Xpress Software Solutions Ltd|303 Sperry Way, Stonehouse Business Park, Stonehouse, Gloucestershire, United Kingdom, GL10 3UT|NONE||No|No]

Title: AGMA Electoral Management System
Description:
The contract is for the provision of an electoral registration and elections management system and elections management system including associated support and maintenance capable of managing all aspects of elections and electoral registration processes in accordance with current and future legislation and to enable Returning Officers  / Electoral Registration Officer  to meet statutory deadlines. The lead authority for this procurement exercise is Trafford Council on behalf of the Association of Greater Manchester Authorities (AGMA).  AGMA is a partnership between 10 Local Authorities and other public sector bodies within the Greater Manchester Area. In addition, AGMA has a number of associate members from Greater Manchester and the surrounding areas. 

The Local Authority letting the agreement (Trafford Council) will be establishing this agreement by or on behalf of those AGMA members, associate members and the associate bodies linked to these Authorities. Participating local authorities in this contract include Bury, Bolton, Manchester, Oldham, Rochdale, Salford, Stockport, Tameside, Trafford and Wigan, plus associate AGMA members, Blackpool (will be joining 1st July 2019) and Blackburn with Darwen. It is conceivable that AGMA membership and associate membership may change over the life of the AGREEMENT, and hence either expand or contract the list of contracting bodies eligible to use this Agreement.
